{{for|the Lincolnshire politician|Sir Robert Pattinson}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{pp-move-indef}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2011}} {{Use British English|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Robert Pattinson | image = Robert Pattinson 01.jpg | caption = Pattinson at the premiere of ''[[Water for Elephants (film)|Water for Elephants]]'' in 2011. | birth_name = Robert Douglas Thomas Pattinson | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1986|5|13}} | birth_place = London, England, UK | other_names = Rob, R-Pattz,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.definition-of.com/rpattz|title=''Rpattz'' definition|publisher=Definition â of|accessdate=3 August 2009}}</ref> Spunk Ransom<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/videos/movies/237780/spunk-ransom-is-catching-on.jhtml |title=Spunk Ransom is catching on|work=MTV|accessdate=3 September 2009}}</ref> (nicknames) | occupation = Actor, model, musician, producer | yearsactive = 2004âpresent | relatives = [[Lizzy Pattinson]] (sister) | signature = Robert Pattinson signature.svg }} '''Robert Douglas Thomas Pattinson'''<ref name=birth>''Births, Marriages & Deaths Index of England & Wales, 1916â2005.''; at ancestry.com</ref> (born 13 May 1986)<ref name="People">{{Cite news|title=Robert Pattinson|url=http://www.people.com/people/robert_pattinson|work=People |accessdate=3 April 2009}}</ref> is an English actor, model, musician, and producer.<ref name="LA Times">{{Cite news|author=Gina McIntyre|title=Robert Pattinson on his 'Twilight' songs: 'Music is my backup plan if acting fails'|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/herocomplex/2008/10/robert-pattin-1.html |work=Los Angeles Times|date=9 October 2008|accessdate=1 February 2009}}</ref> Born and raised in London, Pattinson started out his career by playing the role of [[Cedric Diggory]] in ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]''.<ref>{{Cite news|author=Sona Charaipotra|title=A Night Out With Robert Pattinson|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2008/11/16/fashion/16nite.html?_r=1&ref=movies|work=New York Times|date=14 November 2008|accessdate=11 February 2009}}</ref> Later, he landed the leading role of [[Edward Cullen]] in the [[The Twilight Saga (film series)|film adaptations]] of the [[Twilight (series)|''Twilight'' novels]] by [[Stephenie Meyer]], and came to worldwide fame.<ref>{{cite web|author=Rebecca Murray|title=Robert Pattinson Discusses 'Twilight'|url=http://movies.about.com/od/twilight/a/twilight073108.htm |publisher=About.com|date=31 July 2008|accessdate=11 February 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Hillary Atkin|title=Exclusive Interview: Robert Pattinson|url=http://www.fandango.com/commentator_exclusiveinterview:robertpattinson_203|publisher=Fandango|date=16 November 2008|accessdate=11 February 2009}}</ref> Pattinson was ranked as one of the highest paid actors in Hollywood based on 2009 earnings.<ref name="Vanity Fair">{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/features/2010/03/top-hollywood-earners-201003|title=Peter Newcomb on the Top Hollywood Earners of 2009|date=March 2010|work=Vanity Fair |author=Peter Newcomb|accessdate=10 July 2010}}</ref> In 2010, Pattinson was named one of ''TIME'' magazine's [[Time 100|100 Most Influential People in The World]], and also in the same year ''[[Forbes]]'' ranked him as one of the most powerful celebrities in the world in the [[Forbes Celebrity 100]].<ref name="time">{{Cite news|author=Chris Weitz |title=The 2010 Time 100: Robert Pattinson|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1984685_1984940_1984948,00.html#ixzz0mUOIhqVr|work=Time|date=29 April 2010 |accessdate=2 May 2010 }}</ref><ref name="forbes1">{{cite news|title=The Celebrity 100: No.50 Robert Pattinson|url=http://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/53/celeb-100-10_Robert-Pattinson_TZ0B.html | work=Forbes | date=28 June 2010}}</ref>
==Early life== Pattinson was born in London. His mother, Clare, worked for a modelling agency, and his father, Richard, imported vintage cars from the U.S.<ref>{{cite web|last=Adams |first=Isabelle |url=http://www.harpercollinschildrens.com/HarperChildrens/Kids/BookDetail.aspx?isbn13=9780061765537&BDMode=8 |title=Robert Pattinson |publisher=Harpercollinschildrens.com |accessdate=22 August 2010}}</ref> Pattinson has two elder sisters, singer [[Lizzy Pattinson]], and Victoria Pattinson.<ref name="telegraph">{{cite news|last=Tibbetts|first=Graham|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/celebritynews/3541846/Profile-of-Twilight-star-Robert-Pattinson.html|title=Profile of Twilight star Robert Pattinson|date=2 December 2008|work=The Daily Telegraph |location=UK |accessdate=16 August 2009}}</ref><ref name=Glaswegian>{{Cite news|url=http://www.theglaswegian.co.uk/entertainment-lifestyle/2009/11/26/twighlight-star-robert-pattinson-reveals-his-shy-side-102692-21851022|title=Twighlight star Robert Pattinson reveals his shy side|date=26 November 2009|first=Susan|last=Griffin|publisher=The Glaswegian|accessdate=4 December 2009}}</ref> Growing up in the [[Barnes, London|Barnes]] suburb of London,<ref name="Biography Today">{{Cite book|title=Biography Today|year=2009|page=136|publisher=Omnigraphics|location=[[Detroit]], Michigan |isbn=978-0-7808-1052-5}}</ref> he attended [[Tower House School]] until he was 12, and then [[The Harrodian School]].<ref>"Biography Today", p.136</ref><ref name=Stubbs>{{Cite news| author=Flora Stubbs|title=Potter star 'next Jude Law'|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/film/article-20955856-details/Potter+star+%27next+Jude+Law%27/article.do|publisher=[[Evening Standard]]|date=17 November 2005|accessdate=2 October 2008}}</ref> He became involved in amateur theatre at the Barnes Theatre Company. He auditioned and was cast in a small role in ''[[Guys and Dolls]]''. He next auditioned for [[Thornton Wilder]]'s ''[[Our Town]]'' and was cast as George Gibbs. He also played in ''[[Anything Goes]]'' and ''[[Macbeth]]''.<ref>"Biography Today", p. 137</ref> He caught the attention of an acting agent in a production of ''[[Tess of the d'Urbervilles]]'' and began looking for professional roles.
==Career== ===Model<!--British English-->ling=== Pattinson began modelling when he was twelve years old, but the number of jobs began to decrease only four years later. In December 2008 he blamed the lack of work as a model on his masculine appearance: "When I first started I was quite tall and looked like a girl, so I got lots of jobs, because it was during that period where the [[androgyny|androgynous]] look was cool. Then, I guess, I became too much of a guy, so I never got any more jobs. I had the most unsuccessful modelling career."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/daily/fashion/2008/12/why_robert_pattinsons_modeling.html|title=Why Robert Pattinson's Modeling |work=New York Magazine}}</ref> Pattinson appeared in the advertising campaign for [[Hackett (clothing)|Hackett's]] autumn 2007 collection.<ref name="Hackett">{{cite web|title=Robert Pattinson-Hackett Campaign|publisher=Nachophoto.com|url=http://nachofoto.com/photo-of-Robert-Pattinson-Hackett-Campaign-4ac9aa70ac4f|accessdate=16 August 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>
===Acting=== [[File:Robert Pattinson Cropped.jpg|thumb|190px|left|Pattinson in 2009]] Pattinson had supporting roles in the made for television film ''[[Dark Kingdom: The Dragon King|Ring of the Nibelungs]]'' in 2004 and in director [[Mira Nair]]âs ''[[Vanity Fair (2004 film)|Vanity Fair]]'', although his scenes in the latter were deleted and only appear on the DVD version.<ref name=National>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenational.ae/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20091121/MAGAZINE/711209966/1284|title=Something to sink his teeth into|date=21 November 2009|work=[[The National (Abu Dhabi)|The National]]|first=Peter|last=Howell|accessdate=4 December 2009}}{{dead link|date=January 2011}}</ref> In May 2005, he was slated to appear in the UK premiere of ''The Woman Before'' at the [[Royal Court Theatre]], but was fired shortly before the opening night and was replaced by [[Tom Riley (actor)|Tom Riley]].<ref name=STV>{{Cite news|url=http://entertainment.stv.tv/new-moon/whos-who/136806-new-moon-whos-who|title=Robert Pattinson: Teen heartthrob Robert Pattinson is an English actor, model and musician best known for playing vampire Edward Cullen in Twilight|date=12 November 2009|publisher=[[STV (TV network)]]|accessdate=4 December 2009}}</ref> Later that year he played [[Cedric Diggory]] in ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (movie)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]''. For this role he was named that year's ''British Star of Tomorrow'' by ''[[The Times]]''.<ref>{{cite news|author=Lisa Dillon|title=Almost famous|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/film/article526398.ece?token=null&offset=0|work=The Times |location=UK |date=26 May 2005|accessdate=2 October 2008}}</ref> He has more than once been touted as the next [[Jude Law]].<ref name=Stubbs/><ref>{{cite web|title=Top 20 Rising Stars Under 30|url=http://www.snmag.com/MAGAZINE/Features/Top-20-Rising-Stars-Under-30.html|work=[[Saturday Night Magazine (US)|Saturday Night Magazine]]|date=29 July 2008|accessdate=2 October 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Teen People Names 'Artists of the Year' and 'What's Next'|url=http://www.starpulse.com/news/index.php/2005/11/02/teen_people_names_artists_of_the_year_an|publisher=Starpulse|date=2 November 2005|accessdate=2 October 2008}}</ref>
Pattinson played [[Edward Cullen]] in the film ''[[Twilight (2008 film)|Twilight]]'', based on [[Stephenie Meyer]]'s best-selling novel of the same name, which was released on 21 November 2008 in North America. According to ''[[TV Guide]]'', Pattinson was initially apprehensive about auditioning for the role of Edward Cullen, fearful that he would not be able to live up to the "perfection" expected from the character.<ref>{{cite web|title=Before the Spotlight, Twilight's Robert Pattinson Was Intimidated by "Perfect" Role|url=http://movies.tvguide.com/Movie-News/Twilight-Robert-Pattinson-1000071.aspx|work=[[TV Guide]]|date=21 November 2008|accessdate=26 November 2008}}</ref> He reprised his role as Edward Cullen in the ''Twilight'' sequels ''[[The Twilight Saga: New Moon]]'' and ''[[The Twilight Saga: Eclipse]]'', which was released 30 June 2010.<ref>{{cite web|author=Adam Rosenberg|title='The Twilight Saga: Eclipse' Shoot Dates Revealed!|url=http://moviesblog.mtv.com/2009/06/30/the-twilight-saga-eclipse-shoot-dates-revealed|publisher=MTV|date=30 June 2009|accessdate=7 October 2009}}</ref>
Pattinson had lead roles in the feature films ''[[Little Ashes]]'' (in which he plays [[Salvador DalÃ­]]), ''[[How to Be]]'' (a British comedy), and the [[short film]] ''The Summer House''.
In 2009, Pattinson presented at the [[81st Academy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Josh Horowitz |title=Report: Robert Pattinson To Present At Academy Awards|url=http://moviesblog.mtv.com/2009/02/17/report-robert-pattinson-to-present-at-academy-awards/ |publisher=MTV |date=17 February 2009|accessdate=9 August 2009 }}</ref> On 10 November, [[Revolver Entertainment]] released the DVD ''Robsessed'', a documentary which details Pattinson's life and popularity.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/movies/news/articles/1623159/story.jhtml|title=Robert Pattinson's Life Is Subject Of 'Robsessed' Documentary|last=Ditzian|first=Eric|date=6 October 2009|work=MTV|accessdate=9 November 2009}}</ref>
In 2010, Pattinson [[Executive producer|executively produced]] and starred in the film ''[[Remember Me (2010 film)|Remember Me]]'', which was released on 12 March 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.summit-ent.com/content.php?subj=4&sel_page=194|title=Remember Me|publisher=Summit Entertainment|accessdate=11 January 2010}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> On 13 May 2010, Pattinson appeared on ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'' for ''[[The Twilight Saga: Eclipse]]'' and also made an appearance on ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'' on 18 May, which aired the following day.<ref>{{cite news|title='Twilight' stars Robert Pattinson, Kristen Stewart, Taylor Lautner coming to 'Oprah'|url=http://leisureblogs.chicagotribune.com/about-last-night/2010/04/twilight-stars-robert-pattinson-kristen-stewart-taylor-lautner-coming-to-oprah.html|work=Chicago Tribune|date=23 April 2010|accessdate=2 May 2010}}</ref> Pattinson attended the official worldwide red carpet premiere for ''The Twilight Saga: Eclipse'' on 24 June 2010 at the [[L.A. Live#Nokia Theatre|Los Angeles Nokia Theatre]].<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/news/ni2325731/ Robert Pattinson, Kristen Stewartâs Eclipse World Premiere at Los Angeles Film Festival 2010<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In 2011, he starred in ''[[Water for Elephants (film)|Water for Elephants]]'', a film adaptation of the [[Sara Gruen]] novel of the [[Water for Elephants|same name]], with [[Christoph Waltz]] and [[Reese Witherspoon]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118014118.html?categoryid=13&cs=1|title=Penn, Pattinson circle 'Water'|date=21 January 2010|work=Variety |author=Pamela McClintock|accessdate=23 January 2010}}</ref>
He will play Georges Duroy in a [[Bel Ami (2011 film)|film adaptation]] of the 1885 novel ''[[Bel Ami]]'', with [[Uma Thurman]], which will be released in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.collider.com/2010/01/08/christina-ricci-joins-robert-pattinson-in-bel-ami/|title=Christina Ricci Joins Robert Pattinson in BEL AMI|date=8 January 2010|publisher=[[Collider]]|accessdate=11 January 2010}}</ref> He will also appear in a theatre production for producer [[David Pugh and Dafydd Rogers|David Pugh]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118000137.html?categoryid=15&cs=1&nid=2562|author=David Benedict|title='Equus' closure prompts rumors|work=Variety |date=13 February 2009|accessdate=23 February 2009 }}</ref>
===Music=== Pattinson plays guitar and piano, and composes his own music.<ref>{{cite web|title=Robert Pattinson: 'I'm Really Not That Interesting'|url=http://www.theimproper.com/Template_Article.aspx?IssueId=10&ArticleId=3071|publisher=The Improper|accessdate=1 February 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> He also appears as the singer of two songs on the [[Twilight (soundtrack)|''Twilight'' soundtrack]]: "Never Think", which he co-wrote with Sam Bradley,<ref>{{cite web|title=Sam Bradley Interview|url=http://www.portraitmagazine.net/interviews/sambradley.html|publisher=Portrait Magazine|date=December 2008|accessdate=30 January 2009}}</ref> and "Let Me Sign", which was written by Marcus Foster and Bobby Long.<ref>{{cite web|author=Becky Reed|title=Twilight Star Talks Soundtrack|url=http://www.clickmusic.com/articles/9942/Twilight-Star-Talks-Soundtrack.html|publisher=Click Music|accessdate=30 January 2009}}</ref> The songs were included in the film after director [[Catherine Hardwicke]] added Pattinson's recordings into an early cut without his knowledge, and he agreed that "one of them specifically, it really made the scene better. It was like it was supposed to be there."<ref name="LA Times"/> The soundtrack for the film ''[[How to Be]]'' features three original songs performed by Pattinson<ref>{{cite web|title=Robert Pattinson Sings Three Songs in Indie Flick How to Be|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/news/robert-pattinson-sings-in-indie-flick-how-to-be-2009313|publisher=Us Magazine|date=11 March 2009|accessdate=31 March 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> and written by composer Joe Hastings.<ref>{{cite web|title=Songs composed by Joe Hastings in Indie Flick How to Be|url=http://www.howtobemovie.com/soundtrack|publisher=How to Be|date=9 March 2009|accessdate=31 March 2009}}</ref>
Aside from recording for the soundtracks, Pattinson has said, "I've never really recorded anything â I just played in pubs and stuff", and when asked about a professional music career, he said, "Music is my back-up plan if acting fails."<ref name="LA Times"/> In 2010, Pattinson was awarded the 'Hollywood's Most Influential Top Unexpected Musicians' award.
==In the media== [[File:Robert Pattinson 2009.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Pattinson after ''[[The Twilight Saga: New Moon]]'' photo call at [[HÃ´tel de Crillon|Crillon Hotel]] in 2009]] Pattinson was named one of the "Sexiest Men Alive" in 2008 and 2009 by [[People (magazine)|''People'' magazine]].<ref>{{cite web|title=2008's Sexiest Man Alive|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/gallery/0,,20237714_20241212_20545173,00.html#20545173|publisher=[[People (magazine)|People]] |accessdate=27 August 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=2009's Sexiest Man Alive|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/gallery/0,,20315920_20320457,00.html#20705504|publisher=[[People (magazine)|People]] |accessdate=21 November 2009}}</ref> In 2009, he was also named the "Sexiest Man Alive" by ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sexiest Men Alive #1|url=http://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/celebrity/photo-galleries/celebrity-life/090805-50-sexiest-men-voted-by-you.aspx?imageno=1|date=5 August 2009|accessdate=5 August 2009}}</ref> ''[[Ask Men]]'' named Pattinson as one of the top 49 most influential men of 2009.<ref>{{cite web|title=Top 49 Most Influential Men|url=http://www.askmen.com/specials/2009_top_49/robert-pattinson-44.html}}</ref> In 2009, ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'' named Pattinson "the most handsome man in the world" along with [[Angelina Jolie]] as the most beautiful woman in the world.<ref>{{cite web|title=Robert Pattinson the Most Handsome Man in the World|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/online/daily/2009/06/robert-pattinson-is-the-most-handsome-man-in-the-world.html}}</ref>
He was named one of ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]''<nowiki>'</nowiki>s "Top Hollywood Earners of 2009" with estimated earnings of $18 million in 2009.<ref name="Vanity Fair" /><ref>{{cite news|title=Johnny Depp is highest paid actor with Â£21m deal for next Pirates film|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/film-news/6587698/Johnny-Depp-is-highest-paid-actor-with-21m-deal-for-next-Pirates-film.html|date=17 November 2009|accessdate=2 May 2010|location=London|work=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref>
In December 2009, Pattinson autographed a guitar to be auctioned off for charity.<ref name="guitar charity">{{cite web|url=http://www.gossipcop.com/perez-strikes-bad-chord-with-Robert-pattinson-guitar-story|date=18 March 2010|title=Perez strikes bad chord with Robert Pattinson guitar story|work=[[Gossip Cop]]|publisher=Gossip Cop|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref> He also volunteered for the ''[[Hope for Haiti Now: A Global Benefit for Earthquake Relief]]'' in January 2010.<ref name="mtv-liveblog">{{cite web|url=http://newsroom.mtv.com/2010/01/22/hope-for-haiti-live-blog|date=22 January 2010|title=Hope For Haiti Now: A Global Benefit For Earthquake Relief|first=Kyle|last=Anderson|work=[[MTV News]]|accessdate=23 January 2010}}</ref>
''[[GQ]]'' and ''Glamour'' both named him the "Best Dressed Man" of 2010, with ''GQ'' stating, "Extremely elegant and inspiring, the true essence of a contemporary man."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theinsider.com/news/3141381_GQ_Magazine_Names_Robert_Pattinson_Best_Dressed_Man_For_2010|title=GQ Magazine Names Robert Pattinson 'Best Dressed Man' For 2010|date=February 2010|publisher=[[Insider]]}}{{dead link|date=June 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Robert Pattinson And Cheryl Cole Are Named The Best Dressed Of 2010|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/52763/Robert-Pattinson-And-Cheryl-Cole-Are-Named-The-Best-Dressed-Of-2010|publisher=Giant Digital |work=Entertainment Wise|date=6 April 2010|accessdate=2 May 2010}}</ref> In 2010, ''People'' also listed Pattinson in their "World's Most Beautiful" issue.<ref>{{cite web|author=Post to: |url=http://www.people.com/people/package/gallery/0,,20360857_20364406_20776540,00.html |title=World's Most Beautiful |work=People |date=28 April 2010 |accessdate=22 August 2010}}</ref>
In 2010, Britain's ''[[The Sunday Times]]'' "Rich List" put him on its "list of young millionaires" in the UK, worth Â£13 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Rich List 2010: Mittal doubles to Â£22bn, total up 30% to Â£333.5bn|url=http://www.spearswms.com/spears-world/wire/18722/rich-list-2010-mittal-doubles-to-22bn-total-up-30-to-3335bn.thtml|work=Spear's Wealth Management Survey|accessdate=2 May 2010}}</ref> [[Time (magazine)|''Time'' magazine]] named him as one of 2010's [[Time 100|100 Most Influential People in The World]].<ref name="time"/> In June 2010, Pattinson was named by [[Forbes]] magazine the No.50 most powerful celebrity in the world with earnings $17 million.<ref name="forbes1"/> Due to Pattinson's rising fame, a wax statue of him was added to the [[Madame Tussauds]] collection in London and New York City.<ref>{{cite web|title=Robert Pattinson to join Madame Tussauds|url=http://www.madametussauds.com/London/NewsAndEvents/RobertPattinsonAnnounce|publisher=Merlin Entertainment Group|work=MadameTussauds.com|accessdate=2 May 2010}}</ref> On 14 November 2010, Pattinson received two BBC Radio 1 Teen Awards, Best Dressed and Best Actor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2010/11_november/15/teen.shtml |title=Radio 1's Teen Awards winners announced |publisher=BBC |date=15 November 2010 |accessdate=15 March 2011}}</ref>
In 2011, Pattinson was No. 15 on ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'''s "Hollywood Top 40" with earnings of $27.5 million in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/features/2011/03/hollywood-top-earners-201103?currentPage=3 |title=Hollywoodâs Top 40 |publisher=Vanity Fair |first=Peter |last=Newcomb |date=March 2011 |accessdate=15 March 2011}}</ref>
